scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: This collection contains a manuscript of Bowles's poem, "How Many Midnights," and a letter, 1950 October 8, from Bowles, Tangier, Morocco, to William A. Kraus, regarding his travels and mutual friends from the University of Virginia.

did.unittitle: Poem entitled, "How Many Midnights ( A Popular Song)" by Paul Bowles [1931]
did.physdesc: AMsS, written in pencil on seven octavo sheets (on the versos of order forms for the Cortelli Silk Mills).

scopecontent.p: The poem comprises ninety lines of the University of Virginia Cavaliermagazine. The manuscript was laid into a copy of the finished magazine which came from the library of William A. Kraus, student editor of the Cavalierat the time.

did.unittitle: Letter from Paul Bowles to William A. Kraus October 18, 1950

scopecontent.p: Bowles renews his acquaintance with Kraus, apparently a friend from his University of Virginia student days, and brings him up to date on his recent voyages.
